task.title: Washing Clothes in Stackable Laundry Machines
task.shortdesc: Instructions for using stackable laundry machines commonly found in shared housing facilities.

prereq.p: Bring your own laundry detergent, fabric softener, bleach, and any other cleaning agents you would like to use.

step.cmd: Put dirty clothes in the washing machine drum located at the bottom of the stackable unit.

choices.choice: Separate clothes by color and fabric type to prevent damage or color bleeding (optional).

step.cmd: Add the appropriate amount of detergent to the washing machine.

choices.choice: For pods, place it in the washing machine drum before adding clothes.
For liquid or powdered detergent, use the detergent compartment in the pull-out drawer, typically located on the top section of the machine.
Optional: Add bleach and/or fabric softener to their respective compartments in the drawer.

step.cmd: Close the washing machine door securely.
Select the appropriate wash settings on the control panel, usually located above the washing machine door.
step.info: Note: Settings will reset to default after each use, so check the panel before starting a wash cycle.

step.cmd: Press the start button to begin washing.

postreq.p: Set a personal timer to keep track of the remaining wash and dry time.
